msContents.summary:
The Vasudhāradhāraṇī, dedicated to Vasudhārā, the bodhisattva of wealth, prosperity, and abundance (who has a strong following among the Newar Buddhists of the Kathmandu Valley), is taught by the Buddha in Kauśambī to the rich merchant and layman Sucandra. He has been reduced to poverty and so requests a sermon from the Lord so that he may provide for his own family and so that all beings may become prosperous. This scripture includes a dhāraṇī along with enumerations of benefits and ritual instructions for use. This palm-leaf manuscript is dated to 1576 CE, under the reign of ‏Sadāśiva Malla
(1574-1583).

msItem.title: Vasudhārādhāraṇī
Vasudhāraṇī
Vasudhārādhāraṇīsūtra
msItem.incipit: [1v2] kalpoditena vidhinā paripaśyamānā, yā dhārayā vividhiratnasuvarṇṇamayyā | pūrṇṇaṃ ka[1v2]roti bhavana sahasava sarvvaṃ tāṅ kalya sarvvalo %kajanīanī praṇamāmi bhaktyā || ^^ || evaṃ mayā śrutam ekasmin_ samaye bha[1v3]gavān_ kośāmbyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ viharati sma % kaṇṭakasaṃjñke mahāvanavare ghosirālāme mahatā mahābhikṣusaghena sārdhaṃ pa¦[2v3] ñcamātrair bhikṣuśataiḥ sabahuścalaiś ca mahāśrā%vakair asaṃkhyayaś ca bodhisatvair mmahāsatvaiḥ sarvabuddhasamanvāgataiḥ |
[2r2] tena khalu punaḥ samayena kośāṃbyā mahānagaryāṃ sucandro nāma gṛhapatiḥ prativasati sma ||
msItem.explicit: [22r5] idam avocad bhagavān āttamanā āyuṣmān ānandas te ca bhikṣavas te ca bodhisatvā mahāsattvā sā ca sarvāvatī parṣat_ sadevamānuṣāsuraga[22v1]ndharvaloko bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandann iti || ^^^ ||
msItem.colophon: [22v1] ye dharmmā hetuprabhāvā hetu teṣā[22v2]n tathāgato hy avadat teṣāñ ca yo nirodha evaṃvā¦¦%¦¦dī mahāśramanaḥ ||^^^|| dheyadharmo ||^^^|| yaṃ 'pravaramahāyānayāyinaḥ¦ [22v3] paramopāśaka śrīphataśālagṛhādhivāśinajaka%nājabhārobhāryāputrapautrādiḥ sagaraparivārasya yad atra puṇyaṃ tad bhavatv ācāryopādhyā[22v4] yamātāpitṛpurvaṅgamaṅ kṛtvā sakalasatvarāśe¦%r anuttarajñānaphalam avāpnuyād iti || @ || samvat_ 676 jeṣṭamāśe kṛṣṇapakṣe [22v5] caturthyāyāṃ tithau bṛhaspativārasare || mahārājādhirājaparameśvaraparamabhaṭṭārakaśrīśrījayasadāśivamalladevasya mahārājādhirājaparameśvaraparamabhaṭṭāraka-śrīśrījayasadāśivamalladevasya vijayarājye || śubham astu ||

supportDesc.condition: Incomplete, in good condition. The writing is often faded. Folio 19 is damaged, with loss of text.

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 53 akṣaras per line .
layout.stringHole:
One string hole approximately in the center of a square space.
2.2 2.2
layout.p: Triple marginal frame lines in black ink.

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1875.
